intro.description: This tutorial guides you through creating an association that spans two distinct MOMs. This procedure can only be used to define a relationship between either an EcimRootMoClass or EcimMoClass construct in a given EcimMom and an EcimRootMoClass construct in a different EcimMom.

item.title: Activate target/parent model
item.description: Ensure that the target model is activated. From the context menu select MetaModelAgent > Activate > (choose appropriate MetaModel).

item.title: Select source class
item.description: Right-click on the child EcimMoClass in the Project Explorer. In this scenario, the child is the owner of the relationship. Any EcimMoClass construct may be used to begin the definition of such a relationship. A context menu is shown.

item.title: Select EcimContribution [Child-End]
item.description: From the context menu select MetaModelAgent > Add > EcimContribution [Source End].

item.title: Fill in required fields
item.description: Enter appropriate values in the boxes.

item.title: Fill in required fields/Select parent end type
item.description: Enter appropriate values in the boxes. Tick EcimContribution [Parent-End] in the Select kind of opposite association end section.

item.title: Fill in required fields
item.description: Enter appropriate values in the boxes.

item.title: Select Finish
item.description: The EcimContribution construct is now completed.
